Apple removes passwords – Is it more secure?
text:
Source: https://developer.apple.com/documentation/authenticationservices/public-private_key_authentication

I guess this eliminates a few options for bad actors: - brute force - phishing (users don't even know their public-private keys) - can't use application oauth identity to intercept because user creds are probably validated in apples servers

Still has some vulnerabilities though: - hack into iCloud keychain - it's been done before - malicious third party app that can retrieve public-private key pairs from device storage

Ask HN: Do you have a side project to sell?
text:
If you have a side/weekend project or an idea which you started working but no longer interested in it and want to sell then let me know.

A) Idea/Purpose of it. B) Current users/revenue. C) Asking price.

Ask HN: Who on Twitter improves your intellectual and mental health?
text:
I used to be very active on Twitter, but have been dormant for a long time.

I intend to get back into it, but I am finding 99% of content to be utterly vapid, self serving and misdirecting.

In contrast, I have always enjoyed twitter links posted here, even on esoteric topics. So I wanted to ask - who do you follow on Twitter where you get true intellectual or emotional value?

Also happy to get recommendations for Mastodon servers and people!
